overview: Two young girls, a hot, stifling summer, the desire to run away from a small provincial town. Luisa is full of life, uninhibited, unconventional. Renata is dark, angry and in need of love. The lives of two young women is a tale of blackmail, of a love betrayed, of violence: Luisa uses her Albanian boyfriend, Bilal; Renata uses Luisaâ€™s body to orchestrate her revenge. Both want to leave the small community  where  they  have  grown  up  among  village  festivals  and  independence  gatherings, helpless  families  and  new  generations  of  migrants  targeted  by  those  who  feel  increasingly threatened.  Luisa,  Renata  and  Bilal  will  risk loosing themselves, loosing a precious part of themselves, of those they love, ultimately loosing their own lives.
title: Small Homeland
